intro: Cryptandra suavis, commonly known as the sweet cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves that emit a sweet fragrance. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which attract nectar-feeding insects. Cryptandra suavis is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native region.
